items.description: Analyze repository structure and define project scope
items.acceptance_criteria: Written document (in results/) listing all existing repo files, empty directories (figures/, results/), and a clear scope statement: build a minimal Python pendulum simulation with numerical integration, energy tracking, and visualization

items.description: Literature review: classical pendulum dynamics and equations of motion
items.acceptance_criteria: Web search conducted for pendulum physics references (Lagrangian/Newtonian formulations, small-angle approximation, exact elliptic-integral solution). At least 3 textbook or paper references identified and summarized in a notes document

items.description: Literature review: numerical integration methods for ODEs
items.acceptance_criteria: Web search conducted for papers and resources on Euler, RK4, Verlet/Stormer-Verlet, and symplectic integrators applied to Hamiltonian systems. At least 4 distinct methods identified with pros/cons documented

items.description: Literature review: existing open-source pendulum simulation codebases
items.acceptance_criteria: Web search conducted for GitHub repositories and educational codebases implementing pendulum simulations (e.g., matplotlib animations, Pygame demos, Vpython models). At least 3 existing implementations reviewed with architecture notes

items.description: Create and populate sources.bib with all consulted references
items.acceptance_criteria: File sources.bib exists in repo root with valid BibTeX entries. At least 10 relevant references cited covering: classical mechanics textbooks, numerical methods papers, symplectic integrator literature, and existing simulation codebases

items.description: Define mathematical model and select numerical methods
items.acceptance_criteria: Written specification documenting: (1) the nonlinear ODE theta'' = -(g/L)*sin(theta), (2) state-space form [theta, omega], (3) selection of at least two integrators (Euler as baseline, RK4 or symplectic as primary), (4) energy function E = 0.5*m*L^2*omega^2 - m*g*L*cos(theta)

items.description: Implement simple pendulum physics module with Euler integration
items.acceptance_criteria: Python file (e.g., pendulum.py) exists with: Pendulum class or function accepting parameters (L, g, theta0, omega0, dt), Euler method integration step, and state getter returning (theta, omega, t). Module runs without errors when imported

items.description: Implement energy computation and conservation metric
items.acceptance_criteria: Function that computes total mechanical energy E(theta, omega) for given pendulum parameters. A conservation metric defined as max|E(t) - E(0)| / |E(0)| over a simulation run. Euler baseline energy drift quantified over 1000 steps

items.description: Implement basic visualization of pendulum trajectory
items.acceptance_criteria: Script that generates and saves to figures/ at least two plots: (1) theta(t) time series, (2) phase portrait (theta vs omega). Plots saved as PNG files with axis labels and title

items.description: Validate baseline against small-angle analytical solution
items.acceptance_criteria: Comparison of Euler-integrated trajectory vs analytical solution theta(t) = theta0*cos(sqrt(g/L)*t) for theta0 = 0.1 rad. Maximum absolute error computed and reported. Error value documented in results/

items.description: Establish baseline performance benchmarks
items.acceptance_criteria: Timing measurement for 10,000-step simulation run. Memory usage recorded. Results saved to results/baseline_benchmarks.json with fields: wall_time_s, steps, dt, method, energy_drift_ratio

items.description: Implement 4th-order Runge-Kutta (RK4) integrator
items.acceptance_criteria: RK4 integration function implemented and callable with same interface as Euler. Produces trajectory for identical initial conditions. Energy drift over 10,000 steps measured and compared to Euler baseline (expected orders-of-magnitude improvement)

items.description: Implement symplectic Stormer-Verlet integrator
items.acceptance_criteria: Stormer-Verlet (leapfrog) integration function implemented. Energy oscillation bounded (no secular drift) confirmed over 100,000 steps. Comparison to prior work on symplectic methods from sources.bib included in notes

items.description: Add configurable damping to the pendulum model
items.acceptance_criteria: Optional damping coefficient parameter (b) added to simulation: theta'' = -(g/L)*sin(theta) - b*omega. Damped simulation shows monotonically decreasing energy. Overdamped, critically damped, and underdamped regimes demonstrated with at least one plot each saved to figures/

items.description: Implement large-angle regime and compare to exact period formula
items.acceptance_criteria: Simulation run with theta0 = pi/2 and theta0 = 3.0 rad. Period extracted numerically (zero-crossing detection). Compared against exact period T = 4*sqrt(L/g)*K(sin(theta0/2)) using elliptic integral. Relative error < 1% for RK4 with dt <= 0.001

items.description: Create unified simulation runner with method selection
items.acceptance_criteria: Single entry-point function or CLI that accepts: method (euler/rk4/verlet), initial conditions (theta0, omega0), parameters (L, g, dt, n_steps, damping), and output options. Returns structured results dict with trajectory, energy, and timing data

items.description: Convergence study: error vs time-step size for all integrators
items.acceptance_criteria: Sweep dt over [0.1, 0.05, 0.01, 0.005, 0.001, 0.0005]. For each method, compute error vs analytical/reference solution. Log-log plot of error vs dt saved to figures/convergence.png showing expected order (1 for Euler, 2 for Verlet, 4 for RK4). Observed convergence orders documented

items.description: Long-term energy conservation comparison across integrators
items.acceptance_criteria: Run 1,000,000 steps for each method with dt=0.01. Plot energy E(t) vs time for all three methods on same axes. Saved to figures/energy_conservation.png. Euler shows linear drift, RK4 shows slow drift, Verlet shows bounded oscillation. Numerical values of max energy deviation tabulated in results/energy_comparison.json

items.description: Performance benchmarking across integrators
items.acceptance_criteria: Wall-clock time measured for 100,000-step simulation for each method averaged over 5 runs. Results saved to results/performance_benchmarks.json. Cost-per-accuracy tradeoff discussed comparing results to literature benchmarks from sources.bib

items.description: Damping coefficient parameter sweep experiment
items.acceptance_criteria: Sweep damping b over [0, 0.1, 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 5.0] with fixed theta0=pi/4. Plot decay envelopes for each b value. Identify critical damping coefficient b_crit = 2*sqrt(g/L) and verify simulation matches theory. Results and plot saved to figures/damping_sweep.png and results/damping_results.json

items.description: Phase space analysis for varying initial conditions
items.acceptance_criteria: Generate phase portraits (theta vs omega) for theta0 in [0.1, 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0] rad with omega0=0, overlaid on single plot. Separatrix (E = m*g*L) plotted as reference curve. Saved to figures/phase_space.png. Comparison to phase-space descriptions in cited literature noted

items.description: Compile quantitative results summary
items.acceptance_criteria: File results/summary.json created containing: (1) convergence orders per method, (2) energy drift values per method at 10k/100k/1M steps, (3) performance timings, (4) large-angle period errors. All values numeric and machine-readable

items.description: Write project README with usage instructions and results overview
items.acceptance_criteria: README.md updated with: project description, installation/dependencies (Python 3, numpy, matplotlib), usage examples (command-line or script invocation), summary of key findings (which integrator is best for what use case), and references to sources.bib

items.description: Generate final publication-quality figures
items.acceptance_criteria: At least 4 figures in figures/ directory: (1) convergence plot, (2) energy conservation comparison, (3) phase space portraits, (4) damping regimes. All figures have legible fonts (>=10pt), proper axis labels with units, legends, and consistent style. Suitable for inclusion in a technical report

items.description: Final validation and comparison against prior work
items.acceptance_criteria: Document comparing at least 3 quantitative results (convergence order, energy conservation, period accuracy) against published values from sources.bib. Discrepancies, if any, explained. Written summary saved to results/validation_report.md
